text.headline:
History of Machine Learning
1950 – 2023
text.text: The evolution of machines that learn from data.

media.caption: Alan Turing proposes the Turing Test.

text.headline: Turing Test (1950)
text.text: Alan Turing proposes the Turing Test as a way to evaluate whether a machine can exhibit intelligent behavior indistinguishable from a human.

media.caption: Arthur Samuel develops a self-learning checkers program.

text.headline: Samuel's Checkers Program (1952)
text.text: Arthur Samuel creates one of the first machine learning programs, enabling an IBM computer to improve its performance at playing checkers through experience.

media.caption: Foundations of automatic differentiation and backpropagation.

text.headline: Backpropagation Foundations (1970)
text.text: Seppo Linnainmaa publishes work on reverse-mode automatic differentiation, forming the mathematical basis for backpropagation used in neural network training.

media.caption: Stanford Cart demonstrates early autonomous navigation.

text.headline: Stanford Cart (1979)
text.text: Hans Moravec's Stanford Cart becomes an early example of autonomous vehicle research, navigating obstacles using computer vision.

text.headline: Parallel Distributed Processing (1986)
text.text: David Rumelhart and James McClelland popularize neural networks and backpropagation through their work on parallel distributed processing.

media.caption: LSTM architectures enable long-term sequence learning.

text.headline: LSTM Networks (1997)
text.text: Sepp Hochreiter and Jürgen Schmidhuber introduce Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM), allowing neural networks to learn long-range dependencies.

media.caption: AI assists medical diagnosis through imaging.

text.headline: Medical Imaging AI (1999)
text.text: Computer-aided diagnosis systems analyze large mammogram datasets, improving cancer detection accuracy.

text.headline: Deep Learning Revival (2006)
text.text: Geoffrey Hinton and collaborators introduce deep belief networks, helping revive interest in deep neural networks.

media.caption: LSTM models outperform traditional speech systems.

text.headline: Speech Recognition Advances (2007)
text.text: LSTM-based models begin outperforming traditional speech recognition techniques.

text.headline: Deep Learning Breakthrough (2012)
text.text: AlexNet wins the ImageNet competition, demonstrating the power of deep convolutional neural networks.

text.headline: DeepFace & AlphaGo (2014)
text.text: Facebook's DeepFace achieves near-human face recognition accuracy, while AlphaGo showcases advanced game-playing capabilities.

media.caption: AI excels in games and speech recognition.

text.headline: AI Milestones (2015)
text.text: CTC-trained LSTMs improve speech recognition, and AlphaGo defeats top human Go players.

text.headline: LipNet (2016)
text.text: DeepMind's LipNet demonstrates high-accuracy lip-reading directly from video.

text.headline: Waymo Autonomous Vehicles (2017)
text.text: Waymo begins extensive testing of self-driving vehicles and launches autonomous taxi pilots.

text.headline: Virtual Assistants (2019)
text.text: Voice assistants such as Alexa and Google Assistant become widely adopted in homes.

text.headline: GPT-3 & Reinforcement Learning (2020)
text.text: GPT-3 showcases powerful natural language generation, while advances in reinforcement learning expand AI capabilities.

text.headline: Model Scaling (2021)
text.text: Switch Transformers and game-playing AI systems demonstrate unprecedented model scale and performance.

text.headline: Large Language Models Era (2023)
text.text: GPT-4 and Google Bard bring advanced generative AI to public-facing applications.
